definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To congregate in or head towards a place in large numbers.
examples: People flocked to the cinema to see the new film.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , obsolete ) To flock to; to crowd.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To congregate in or head towards a place in large numbers.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , obsolete ) To flock to; to crowd.

definitions.definition: To coat a surface with dense fibers or particles; especially, to create a dense arrangement of fibers with a desired nap .
examples: the sampling and elution advantages of flocked swabs versus spun swabs

definitions.definition: To cover a Christmas tree with artificial snow.
To treat a pool with chemicals to remove suspended particles.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To coat a surface with dense fibers or particles; especially, to create a dense arrangement of fibers with a desired nap .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To cover a Christmas tree with artificial snow.
( transitive ) To treat a pool with chemicals to remove suspended particles.
